title: Business Analyst inom bank och finans med inriktining mot AML och KYC
description:
**Hej och välkommen till oss på Capgemini! Tillsammans skapar vi mervärde och omvandlar affärsbehov till högteknologiska IT-lösningar.** 




  





**OM OSS** 




  





 Enheten
 **Financial Services** 
 är en del av en global organisation inom Capgemini. Vilket innebär att vi arbetar med kunder i Sverige men också i andra länder i Europa. I Stockholm består vårt team av drivna kollegor med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och vi arbetar alla med de största bank- och försäkringsbolagen. Du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden.
 



  





**OM ROLLEN** 




  





 Som
 **Business Analyst** 
 arbetar du i uppdrag hos våra kunder inom bank- och finans, till dessa hör till exempel flertalet storbanker. I våra tvärfunktionella konsultteam blir du som betrodd rådgivare länken mellan kunden och utvecklingsteamet för att säkerställa en framgångsrik implementering av AML- och KYC-lösningar. Du kommer att driva processer, kartlägga affärsbehov, formulera och definiera tekniska- samt affärskrav
 



  





*I rollen hos oss får du:* 




  




* Analysera system och processer relaterade till Financial Crime Prevention, Anti-Financial Crime och KYC compliance.
* Utgå från ett rådgivande förhållningssätt kopplat till penningtvättsregelverken och AML-riskbedömning.
* Utveckla projekt- och leveransplaner för implementeringsarbetet av teknologilösningar skräddarsydda för att möta de AML- och KYC-utmaningar som kunderna står inför.
* Tillhandahålla utbildning och stöd till slutanvändare.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om teknologier, industritrender och regulatoriska förändringar som påverkar AML- och KYC-praxis.



  





**DIN PROFIL** 




  




* Minst 4–5 års erfarenhet som Business Analyst/Kravanalytiker med affärsförståelse inom finansbranschen.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult.
* Erfarenhet inom konsekvensanalys samt av att omvandla affärsbehov till affärskrav.
* Erfarenhet från Financial Crime Prevention, Anti-Financial Crime och KYC.
* Erfarenhet av programvaruplattformar som t.ex. Nice Actimize, LexisNexis, Accuity, DowJones, Netreveal, Pega eller Salesforce.
* Certifieringar inom AML är önskvärda.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.



  





**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS** 




  





 För oss är delaktighet och gemenskapen viktig och vi ses så ofta vi kan för gemensamma aktiviteter som lunchträffar, afterworks och kompetensutbyte. Vi hjälper dig med kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och intressanta kunduppdrag för en gedigen karriärutveckling. Samtidigt som vi har en nära dialog kring hur livspusslet bäst ska gå ihop.
 



  





**ANSÖKAN** 




  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss! Vi inleder våra processer med att prata om vad du är intresserad av att göra som nästa steg och vi är genuint nyfikna över vilka faktorer som får dig att trivas på jobbet.

title: Trading Manager
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
**Are you ready to lead the way in holistic video planning and media product development? We’re seeking an innovative Trading & Video Manager to shape impactful strategies and maximize value for our clients!**
 As a Trading & Video Manager, you will focus strongly on holistic video planning and product development.
   

  

 You will play a key role in ensuring that the agency’s pricing guarantees across all media with cost commitments are met and that our video investments are optimized in accordance with partner agreements and other strategic considerations.
   

  

 You will work closely with client and specialist teams to identify new opportunities and needs, acting as their expert representative in dialogues with the broader Trading & Investment organization. An important part of your work will be to ensure that our video and media products are competitive and meet the long-term goals of both our agency and our clients.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Main responsibilities include:
   

  

* Responsibility for holistic video planning.
* Development of media products.
* Ensuring compliance with the agency’s pricing guarantees (cost commitments across all media) and optimizing video investments based on partner agreements.
* Training specialist managers and client teams on Publicis Media’s video strategy and product portfolio.
* Setting KPIs and following up on and optimizing partnerships across all media and the video product portfolio.
* Participating in strategic and tactical planning with client teams to maximize the use of the video portfolio.
* Contributing to pitches, strategy presentations, and onboarding of new clients with a focus on video.


 You will be part of the Investment & Trading team, with ties to Apex, and are expected to contribute to knowledge sharing and skills development within Publicis Media. In this role, you will collaborate with specialist managers and other stakeholders to ensure that we fulfill our commitments to clients and partners, with a particular focus on video.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 1-3 years of experience in media planning, trading, or video investments, ideally at a media agency or broadcaster.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field preferred.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret data and optimize media investments.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to build effective partnerships.
* Solid understanding of the media landscape, including video and digital trends.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Demand Planning Transformation Manager Europe
description:
**Join Us Where Great Consumer Experience Begins.**
 Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.
   

  

**About the role:**
 Demand Planning at Electrolux in Europe is undergoing a transformation from a local, collaborative approach to planning with main input derived from sales teams to more fact-based and data-driven regional and European forecasting with higher use of external input, statistical methods and machine learning capabilities.
   

  

 As Demand Planning Transformation Manager, you will be responsible for driving Demand Planning transformation agenda for Europe, which includes transformation of local and European organizations, review and re-design of Demand Planning Operating Model (ways of working), and change management.
   

  

 You will be reporting to Head of Demand Planning Europe and be a member of the European Demand Planning Leadership team.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* In first phase, together with external partners, you will review, re-design and propose best-in class ways of working for Demand Planning organization at Electrolux including processes, governance model (metrics and meeting structure) and capabilities needed to succeed.
* Together with external partners, you will implement SAP IBP module for Demand Planning at Electrolux utilizing and capitalizing on new functionalities, possibilities to automatize processes and save time.
* As an outcome of proposed changes in ways or working, you will recommend the best organizational set up, both for local and European Demand Planning organizations.
* In second phase, you will build and lead a Centre of Excellence organization for European Demand Planning organization to build competencies around more data-driven forecasting using more external data (macro-economic trends, market share information, stock and sell out data from customers, etc.) and new technologies such as statistical methods, AI, machine learning, demand sensing, etc.
* You will drive change management needed to deliver the new Operating model in Demand Planning.
* You will be the core contact point with other stakeholders (Sales, Supply Chain, Product Management teams, etc.) making sure the new Operating model in Demand Planning is meeting their requirements and is a good fit for the business overall.


**Who you are:**
* Previous experience in driving change in Demand Planning organizations in international environment is required.
* You have a strong strategy and business understanding to anticipate and respond to stakeholders’ needs with relevant solutions.
* Demonstrated ability to influence on all levels in an organization.
* Excellent communication skills are required.
* You are comfortable exploring new solutions and driving continuous improvement.
* You thrive in a fast-paced, numbers-oriented environment and can meet deadlines under tight time constraints.
* You can join the dots to take the business from where we are to where we want to be, mapping the clear routes and strategies essential to achieving our goals.
* Excellent understanding of a typical Demand Planning IT environment and working with SAP IBP (Integrated Business Planning) DP module or other planning tools.
* Excellent Microsoft skills.
* Academic degree in business and/or technical field is desired.


**Where you’ll be:**
 This position can be based in any of our European offices (e.g. Stockholm, Wroclaw, Warsaw).
   

  

 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

title: Tax Manager EMEA
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 In this role, you will oversee and manage the tax compliance processes across the EMEA region, ensuring adherence to local, regional and international tax regulations. This critical role will be supported by a mix of local external tax advisors, and it will closely collaborate with the FinOps EMEA team and Group Tax to #makeithappen. You will also play a vital EMEA centric tax advisory role in exciting regional and Sinch wide initiatives such as new product launches and the Finance Transformation program.
   

  

 This role will be based at our HQ in Stockholm and report to our Head of Finance Operations EMEA.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Tax Compliance Management**
* Oversee and coordinate all tax compliance activities across EMEA, including corporate income tax, VAT/GST, withholding taxes, and other local taxes in collaboration with external advisors.
* Ensure timely and accurate filing of tax returns, tax financial statements, and other regulatory reports in compliance with local tax regulations.
* Lead the implementation of best practices for tax compliance, optimizing processes to improve accuracy, efficiency, and compliance rates.
* Own external tax advisor relationships with the aim of full compliance across region and effectively engage them as needed to arrive at low risk but commercially viable solutions.


**Tax Reporting and Documentation**
* Review tax provisions for financial reporting under IFRS/GAAP in coordination with the FinOps EMEA accounting teams.
* Maintain accurate tax records and documentation to support audits, financial statements, and regulatory inquiries.
* Oversee and improve processes for tax reporting within the company's ERP and tax reporting systems.


**Audit Support and Risk Management**
* Act as the main point of contact for tax authorities in the EMEA region, managing tax audits, responding to inquiries, and ensuring successful resolution of issues.
* Collaborate with internal teams and external consultants on audits, risk assessment, and implementing corrective actions if needed.
* Develop and implement controls to identify and mitigate tax risks in the EMEA region.
* Monitor changes in tax legislation within the EMEA region, assess potential impacts, and communicate updates to stakeholders.


**Transfer Pricing**
* Support all transfer pricing requirements within the region in partnership with Group Transfer Pricing and local FinOps teams, including review and execution of local strategies and documentation across multiple jurisdictions.


**Process Improvement and Technology**
* Drive process improvements and automation initiatives within the EMEA tax compliance function, leveraging technology to increase accuracy and reduce manual work.
* Support the adoption and integration of tax compliance software or ERP solutions for enhanced data accuracy and streamlined reporting.


**Requirements**
* Relevant experience in tax compliance, preferably from a mix of multinational corporation and Big 4 accounting firm
* Strong technical knowledge of Swedish corporate income tax and VAT, other EMEA countries is a big plus
* Strong knowledge of IFRS tax effect accounting and standards
* Prior experience participating in ERP implementation projects is a plus, especially with regards to configuring tax-related processes, integrating compliance requirements, and optimizing tax reporting within ERP systems
* Experience with tax automation and data analytics tools
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Law or Finance/Accounting
* Proficient in utilizing Microsoft Office programs and finance tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English
   

  

**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Sourcing & Procurement Consultant or Manager
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming Sourcing and Procurement to be future-ready – and make it an irreplaceable driver of 360º value for the business? If yes, you have come to the right place. Our team within Supply Chain & Operations Practice focus on key topics for CEOs, COOs, Supply Chain and Procurement Chief Officers – to create new competitive agility through profitability, growth, sustainability, resilience and trust.
   

  

**Accenture’s Supply Chain & Operations team** 
 is a world leading practice with a local presence in the Nordics (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland) and utilizing truly global capabilities. We are a team that is
 **passionate about solving complex problems in Supply Chains** 
 to position our clients for sustainable growth, while remaining resilient in times of change. We
 **deliver value by aligning Supply Chain’s strategy, operating model and underlying processes to support business strategies** 
 . Strategy, technology, analytics and solid execution are at the core of our efforts in configuring future-proof Supply Chain and Sourcing & Procurement functions that deliver on the promise of a better and more sustainable world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Sourcing & Procurement Consultant or Manager** 
 to make a difference in
 **project deliveries and business development** 
 in
 **Denmark and in the Nordics** 
 .
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
- Play an important role in Nordic Sourcing & Procurement Community - focusing on enabling change in procurement strategy, operating model design, generative AI, sustainability, Source-to-Pay (S2P) transformations to name a few of the areas

- Together with the team you will identify and pursue new business opportunities and build a pipeline of relevant client work across industries

- Lead and contribute to variety of project deliveries

- Work alongside our clients in their organizations and drive sourcing & procurement to the future

- Contribute towards the growth of our team & the development of our people

**About you:**
- 4 -10 years of relevant sourcing and procurement experience

- Preferably experience in strategy and/or technology consulting but not mandatory

- Ability to identify business opportunities, shape deals, prepare proposals together with clients and expert teams

- Excellent inter-personal skills and the ability to influence, collaborate, partner, motivate and build relationships

- Excellent communication (written and oral) skills in English and Finnish

- M.Sc. degree or equivalent

**What we offer you:**
 We have fun at work and we focus on good work-life balance. We work across Nordics and we support and root for one another. We are psychologically safe environment and everyone´s allowed to be their true selves. Also,
   

  

  

- Truly competitive salary terms, bonus program, health insurance and culture & sports benefits

- Good arrangements to combine family life (and leisure time in general) with work life.

- Extensive wellbeing program that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy and ability to work in a sustainable way

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks

- Talent Lead / Personal Mentor to guide your career within Accenture´s (global) possibilities

- Market-leading expertise and great learning & growth opportunities within technology consulting

**The workplace can be in Copenhagen, Stockholm or Oslo!**
**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! Please apply via our system and remember to enclose your CV and cover letter.
 **There is no better place and time to be in Sourcing & Procurement than right here and right now!** 
 If you have any questions concerning the role or the recruiting process, please contact Magnus Wigernäs +46 76 767 2134, Senior Recruiting Specialist, Strategy & Consulting.
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here*

title: Senior säkerhetsskyddskonsult
description:
Rejlers är en av Nordens ledande konsultföretag. Med vår spetskompetens hjälper vi företag, myndigheter och andra organisationer att möta morgondagens samhällsutmaningar.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Rejlers affärsområde inom samhällssäkerhet växer och vi önskar oss nu fler kollegor inom en bredd av kompetenser, allt från att utveckla metoder till regelefterlevnad. Utifrån vårt ständiga lärande och vår gedigna erfarenhet om nya hot och risker levererar Rejlers lösningar inom säkerhetsskydd till myndigheter, företag och kommuner.
   

  

 Vi söker nu fler kollegor, juniora som seniora, med erfarenheter av säkerhetsarbete inom ett eller flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Informationssäkerhet i IT-system
* Personalsäkerhet med säkerhetsprövningar
* Fysisksäkerhet med systemuppbyggnad
* Beredskapsplanering med analys, plan och uppföljande verksamhet


 I rollen som senior säkerhetsskyddskonsult blir du en del av vårt samhällssäkerhetsteam. Teamet jobbar idag med informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet, fysisk säkerhet och beredskapsplanering. Våra uppdrag varierar i såväl komplexitet som omfattning och våra kunder återfinns i alla branscher och återfinns i hela landet.
   

  

 WHO ARE YOU?
   

  

 Rollen som säkerhetsskyddskonsult kräver att du har arbetslivserfarenhet inom säkerhetsskydd, gärna med erfarenhet från både privat och offentlig sektor. Du är utbildad inom säkerhetsskydd och har arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha genomfört säkerhetsskyddsanalyser, säkerhetssamordning samt implementerat säkerhetsskyddsåtgärder inom organisationer och verksamheter.
   

  

 För den här rollen krävs att du:
   

  

 ✔ Obehindrat kommunicerar på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
   

  

 ✔ Innehar svenskt medborgarskap samt godkänd säkerhetsprövning
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har fördjupade kunskaper inom något av följande områden:
   

  

* Informationssäkerhet
* Personalsäkerhet
* Fysisk säkerhet
* Säkerhetsskyddad upphandling


 Som person är du prestigelös, flexibel och trivs i samarbete och dialog med såväl kollegor som kunder. Dessutom bör du vara självgående, trivas med eget ansvar samt ha förmågan att ta egna initiativ och självständigt driva projekt. Din handlingskraft säkerställer att saker händer! Eftersom tjänsten kan komma att kräva resor till våra kunder är det viktigt att du även är resbenägen.
   

  

**What You Get**
 Gruppen består av ett 20-tal konsulter med olika lång erfarenhet från Försvarssektorn. Ledarskapet inom gruppen präglas av gemensamt arbete mot enhetens mål, uppdragstaktik inom respektive tilldelat ansvarsområde och en stor möjlighet att påverka sin egen arbetssituation.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av framväxten av det moderna samhället och röra dig i teknikens absoluta framkant? Vill du arbeta på en modern arbetsplats där vi bryr oss om varandra, har stor framtidstro och är övertygade om att teamwork är nyckeln till framgång?
   

  

 De tre huvudkomponenterna i vår vision
 **Home** 
 ,
 **Learning** 
 och
 **Minds** 
 fångar alla viktiga aspekter av vårt löfte. Vi är ett hem för våra medarbetare och våra kunder, ett hem byggt på tillit och öppenhet. Med vår inställning, att alltid omfamna dagens och morgondagens mest komplexa utmaningar, i kombination med kontinuerligt lärande utvecklar och inspirerar vi varandra, våra kunder och partners
 **#HomeOfTheLearningMinds**
 🤶🎅
   

  

**Under julledigheten kan det dröja lite längre innan du får återkoppling från oss. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och hoppas att du får en fantastisk helgperiod!**
*Som ett kvalitativt led i våra rekryteringsprocesser kommer en bakgrundskontroll genomföras på slutkandidaten. Vissa roller kräver även annan kontroll, såsom t.ex. säkerhetsprövning, innan uppdrag hos vissa kunder - om det är aktuellt för tjänsten du sökt så kommer du att få mer information kring det i ett senare skede. Ytterligare information hittar du även här:* 
  

  

 Behandling av personuppgifter | Rejlers
   

  

*Vi granskar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag.*

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about IT Security and ready for a new challenge? Join RaySearch as one of our IT Security Specialists and help us advance cancer care.
   

  

**About The Position**
 RaySearch develops state of the art oncology software used at clinics around the world to treat cancer patients in an efficient way. As an IT Security Specialist at RaySearch you will play a crucial role in ensuring the security and integrity of the secure software development life cycle and our IT infrastructure and the secure software development life cycle. Your primary responsibilities will revolve around implementation and maintenance of security measures to protect our systems and data while ensuring that product cyber security management activities and output are compliant with our procedures.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Coordinate cyber security management activities, including post market.
* Identifying vulnerabilities, design and implement protective measures, and ensure compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
* Security monitoring and incident response.
* Regular security assessments and audit activities of products and infrastructure.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of security incidents, assessments, and measures.
* Support and training for development.
* Contribute to the development of strategic security plans that align with our broader business objectives.


**Your profile**
 We believe that you have proven experience in IT Security, which has given you a solid understanding of security principles, practices and technologies. You are analytical and possess excellent problem-solving skills that enable you to critically assess risks, develop robust solutions and make informed decisions that strengthens our security posture.
   

  

 We also believe that you are an independent and self-motivated individual who takes initiative. Since you will have regular communication with both internal teams and external stakeholders, we value your social skills, strong communication abilities, and your sense of responsibility.
   

  

 A collaborative mindset is essential, as you'll be working closely with diverse teams—including risk managers, testers, and core development teams—to implement a unified approach to security. Your ability to keep stakeholders informed about security issues, initiatives, and progress is a key part of your role, and we appreciate candidates who excel in fostering clear and open communication.
   

  

**Essential experience & skills:**
* Degree in Computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with security monitoring tools and incident response procedures.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English).
* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are a plus.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySearch is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Please note that we are approaching the holiday season. A response to your application may be delayed until January.

title: IT Tekniker med fokus på nätverk och konferensutrustning
description:
Vi söker en
 **IT Tekniker** 
 till ett spännande uppdrag hos en av våra kunder! Är du en tekniskt kunnig och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet av nätverk och videokonferenssystem? Då kan denna roll vara något för dig!
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med:
   

  

* Nätverkslösningar: LAN, WAN samt isolerade och segmenterade nätverk.
* Videokonferenssystem: Cisco-baserade lösningar integrerade med myndighetsnätverk och gateway-kopplingar.
* IT-miljö: Arbeta med Cisco-switchar, brandväggar och Fortinet-sviten.
* Telefonibrygga: Hanterar en del ärenden.
* Operativsystem: Windows och Microsoft-produkter, men även användning av Linux.


 Du kommer att bidra till att säkerställa att nätverk och konferensutrustning fungerar sömlöst, samt att de är korrekt konfigurerade enligt organisationens behov.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Fortinet-sviten inom nätverksutrustning och Cisco-videokonferenslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av brandväggar, gateway-kopplingar och segmenterade nätverk.
* Förmågan att snabbt sätta dig in i nya miljöer och ta initiativ där det behövs.
* En konsultmässig och lösningsorienterad attityd. Du är vänlig, professionell och har ett varmt bemötande.


**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   

  

*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Application Support Engineer
description:
**Who we are looking for!**
 We are looking for
 
**Application Support Engineers** 
 to become part of our
 
**SaaS Operations Team** 
 providing business critical operational services to our Customers core software, infrastructure, and integrations. You´ll be the Technical Account Manager for key SaaS Customers and will, in cooperation with Service Manager plan/execute changes, upgrades of our software.
   

  

 You may also work on projects, where you together with the Project Manager and technical teams will be responsible for planning/executing tasks related to setting up environments, integrations, monitoring, software installations. You´ll work close with our Customers building strong Customer Relationships. The SaaS Operations team is involved in monitoring, automations/batch jobs, software installation and upgrades, pipelines setup, interface adjustments and technical support and improvements.
   

  

 Our aim is to provide a higher availability for our Customers and you´ll be able to influence way of working to optimize operations, processes and services.
   

  

**Succeeding the Banqsoft way – Employee DNA**
**Curiosity:** 
 We embrace the 'Why?’. It’s the spark that ignites learning, innovation, and progress
   

  

**Collaboration:** 
 Team players with diverse perspectives have more fun building together
   

  

**Competence:** 
 We're hungry for more! Ever ready for new skills and always seeking to learn
   

  

**Customer Focus:** 
 We're dedicated to enabling our customers' success. We deliver the benefits of technology to make a difference in society, business, and everyday life
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Install, configure, and maintain Microsoft Server-based applications.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
* Provide exceptional customer support by responding to inquiries, diagnosing problems, and offering solutions in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with development teams on application updates, ensuring seamless integration and minimal disruption to services.
* Manage and prioritize multiple customer support tickets while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction.
* Monitor system performance and implement performance tuning.
* Participate in implementation projects, providing technical expertise and support from conception through to deployment.
* Document technical procedures and create user manuals.
* Ensure compliance with security protocols and industry best practices.


**To master the role of Application Support Engineer we believe that you have:**
* At least 5 years’ experience in a technical support role with a focus on applications and Microsoft products (IIS,MS SQL etc.)
* Higher education in IT or relevant studies,
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* A systematic approach, are structured and committed to deliver good results,
* Very good English communication skills, both written and spoken,
* Skills in PowerShell for administrative scripting and automation.
* Knowledge of ITIL methodology,
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on providing outstanding customer service.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.


 If you believe this role aligns with your career aspirations, we would very much like to hear from you!

title: Security Engineer
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re seeking a skilled
 **Security Engineer** 
 to strengthen our core product applications through advanced security design, code review, testing, and implementation. In this role, you’ll assess current security measures, build custom tools for enhanced controls, and collaborate with product teams to elevate their security expertise.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include conducting system tests, supporting compliance, and responding quickly to security incidents. You’ll bring strong experience in application security, risk assessment, and cloud infrastructure, along with excellent communication skills to help teams adopt best security practices. If you’re passionate about building resilient, secure products, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Maintaining a thorough understanding of product and infrastructure security throughout the Product and Technology ecosystem and enabling product teams in secure development and operations of their applications
* Planning, researching, and designing, and developing secure application security capabilities and CI/CD pipelines.
* Developing, reviewing, and collaborating on the configuration of cloud account configuration, network isolation, security groups, access policies, network policies, VPNs, and overall compute platform security, including both host-based and container-based workloads.
* Integrating identity management systems, digital certificates, and secrets management with application workloads.
* Reviewing vulnerabilities with teams and suggesting strategies and tactics for remediation.
* Validating security implementations and participating in remediation and risk acceptance efforts.
* Working with platform and product teams to implement disaster recovery procedures and conducting security breach drills.
* Responding quickly and effectively to all security incidents and providing post-event analyses.
* Guiding the overall security community, cultivating a sense of security awareness, and arranging for continuous education.
* Maintaining and contributing to a growing threat modeling program, and assisting teams continuous improvement in this area.
* Remaining up to date with the latest trends, standards, and products.


**About You**
* A bachelor's or associate's degree in IT, computer science, or equal experience. Advanced education or training in cloud/application security is preferred.
* 5-10 years or more of experience in application development and security.
* Experience with AWS, including EKS, multi-account setups, GuardDuty, KMS, Config, SSM, CloudFront, Firewall Manager, Shield, Network Firewall, WAF, IAM, CloudTrail, Security Hub, Secrets Manager, Inspector, Global Accelerator, ELB, EC2, Athena
* A strong working knowledge of current application and infrastructure risks, secure application design, and operating systems including experience with various Linux distributions and mobile operating systems (Android and iOS).
* Experience developing solutions with Terraform, Terragrunt, and/or Crossplane.
* Experience implementing DevSecOps pipeline tools such as static application security testing (code scanning, dependency scanning, secret scanning) dynamic application security testing, interactive application security testing, container vulnerability scanning, and infrastructure vulnerability scanning
* Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of multiple languages including but not limited to Java, Kotlin, JavaScript, NodeJS, Go, C-Sharp, Swift, Python, bash, and SQL


**What We Offer**
* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* Proactive health support: your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/year

title: Projektledare IT
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en erfaren projektledare för uppdrag inom ett flertal branscher och med stort fokus på offentlig sektor. Arbetet bygger på ett stort intresse för människor, teknik och bryggan där emellan. Konsultrollen innebär i mångt och mycket att vara en rådgivande part gentemot våra kunder och bygga förtroende.
   

  

 I detta uppdrag hjälper du våra kunder med digitalisering genom att driva och leda utvecklings- och implementationsprojekt. Detta i olika typer av digitaliseringsinitiativ, både som förvaltningsledare och projektledare. Du etablerar förtroende och kommunicerar över hela organisationer på operativ till strategisk nivå.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Utifrån våra kunders behov söker vi någon med följande:
   

  

* Du har som huvudprojektledare med budgetansvar drivit t ex olika typer av systemutvecklingsprojekt, systemimplementationer inom IT och/eller digitaliseringsprojekt
* Erfarenhet från uppdrag inom offentlig sektor
* Akademisk examen inom systemutveckling, management eller motsvarande
* Certifiering inom projektledning med erfarenhet av förvaltningsstyrning samt PM3, ITIL eller motsvarande
* Professionell nivå i svenska och engelska muntligt och i skrift är ett krav


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling
* Arbetat som konsult
* Erfarenhet av kravarbete i förstudiefas
* Kunskap om LOU


 Vi lägger stor vikt på dina personliga egenskaper. Du är en relationsbyggande projektledare och konsult som säkerställer bra samarbete och förståelse för kunds behov. Du hanterar stakeholder management väl och etablerar förtroende. Vidare är du affärsinriktad och nätverkande, ser potentiellt mervärde för kund och lyfter förslag genom tydlig kommunikation och presentation.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Som anställd hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett team med härliga kollegor där våra kärnvärden genomsyrar vårt dagliga arbete. För oss innebär det en gemenskap och ett driv att utmana oss själva och våra kunder i att utvecklas och bli starkare. Vårt team består av hjälpsamma och omtänksamma kollegor där vi värderar gemenskap och balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjligheten att ta del av:
   

  

* Möjlighet till hybridarbete om uppdrag/kund inte kräver annat
* Individuell kompetensutvecklingsplan inom ditt spetsområde
* En AFRY Buddy som bollplank under din första tid som anställd
* Tillgång till stort utbud aktiviteter genom vår sociala klubb: Club AFRY, till exempel yoga, restaurangbesök, språkkurser med mera
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner gällande pension, friskvård och föräldraledighet reglerade i vårt kollektivavtal
* Företagsrabatter med externa partners genom vår förmånsportal Advantage You
* Ett enormt nätverk av tekniska experter med + 19 000 kollegor med kontor i 50 och projekt i 100 länder


**Välkommen med din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är 2025-01-31**
**Kontaktperson för frågor:**
 Maria Nordin, Sektionschef
   

  

 maria.nordin@afry.com
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Account Manager IT
description:
*Har du en stark passion för försäljning, ett tekniskt intresse och motiveras av att jobba nära kunden? Vill du ta nästa steg i karriären och hjälpa företag att växa med smarta IT-lösningar? Då vill vi ha din kompetens till vårt kontor i Stockholm!*
 I rollen som Account Mangaer hos Avoki får du hjälpa företag att driva tillväxt genom skräddarsydda IT-lösningar och digital transformation. Vi löser inte bara nuvarande utmaningar, utan är en långsiktig partner som stöttar våra kunder på deras resa mot framtida framgång. Vi söker en Account Manager som är kommunikativ, självgående, flexibel och team-orienterad. Om du trivs i en snabb och utvecklande miljö och drivs av att på riktigt skapa värde och underlätta för dina kunder, då kommer du trivas hos oss!
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och vårda en portfölj av kunder och säkerställa att deras IT-behov möts med innovativa lösningar.
* Utveckla och bibehålla starka relationer med nyckel intressenter för att förbättra kund- nöjdhet och kund- lojalitet.
* Identifiera och förstå kundens behov och tillhandahålla skräddarsydda IT-lösningar som uppfyller deras mål.
* Samarbeta med interna team för att säkerställa smidig service, leverans och kontinuerlig förbättring.


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av B2B sälj och kundansvar (Krav), meriterande inom IT- eller teknik branschen.
* Stark förmåga att kommunicera effektivt både skriftligt och muntligt med kunder och interna team samt erfarenhet av att hantera flera kundkonton samtidigt och säkerställa att lösningarna levereras i tid och med hög kvalitet.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt, förstå och tillgodose kundens behov, ta initiativ och ha ett proaktivt förhållningssätt till problemlösning.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska både i tal & skrift (Krav)
* Körkort B (Krav)


**Avoki erbjuder**
* En flexibel och stödjande arbetsmiljö
* Möjligheter till kontinuerlig utveckling och karriär
* En kultur som värdesätter öppen kommunikation, teamwork och innovativt tänkande
* Generösa förmåner så som Friskvårdstimme, Learning hour och Lunchkort
* Flexibel arbetsplats och möjlighet att arbeta remote


 Är du redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Ansök idag och bli en del av ett företag som värdesätter din expertis samtidigt som vi erbjuder en plattform för din tillväxt och framgång. Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan innan 20 januari.
   

  

*Avoki is the result of the merger of Office Management, Bluecom and Xite. Together, we offer secure and sustainable IT solutions. Avoki is owned by Nalka Invest AB and had a turnover of 1100 MSEK in 2023. We have offices in Stockholm, Uppsala, Gothenburg, Malmö, Helsingborg, Linköping, Luleå, Kramfors, Oslo, Helsinki, and Tampere.*

title: Servicetekniker till Canon
company_industry: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Printing Services
description:
Nu har du möjlighet att bli en del av vårt engagerade team inom Production Service på Canon. Vi ansvarar för att våra kunders produkter inom löpandebana och arkskrivare fungerar optimalt. Vi söker en driven och serviceinriktad tekniker som vill arbeta med att lösa kundernas problem både på plats och via våra digitala hjälpmedel. Som servicetekniker hos oss får du vara en nyckelperson i att leverera högkvalitativ service och hitta kreativa lösningar på tekniska utmaningar.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att ingå i ett team av servicetekniker som är utspridda över hela Sverige. Distriktet sträcker sig från Mälardalen till Sundsvall med Stockholm som utgångspunkt. Du kommer att arbeta över hela Sverige, vilket innebär att resor och övernattningar ingår. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med dina kollegor i teamet, och tjänsten berättigar till antingen tjänstebil eller bruksbil.
   

  

**Vad vi ger**
 Hos Canon får du stöd och uppmuntran från kollegor som delar dina ambitioner och hjälper dig att lyckas och växa. Vi investerar i din professionella utveckling. Våra ledare ger dig friheten att prova nya saker och du ingår i en kultur där vi delar våra framgångar och lär av varandra.
   

  

**I denna tjänst kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter att innefatta**
* Lösning av tekniska problem och incidenter med både hårdvara och programvara i kundernas miljö, på plats eller via digitala hjälpmedel.
* Utföra förebyggande och korrigerande service på våra Canon-produkter.
* Tätt samarbete med andra avdelningar inom Service & Support.
* Kommunicera och planera eventuella uppföljningsåtgärder.
* Administrera och sköta reservdelslager.


**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**
 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som Servicetekniker ser vi gärna att du har
   

  

* En teknisk eller IT-inriktad utbildning, gärna med fokus på El/tele/energi, styr/reglerteknik eller motsvarande.
* Goda kunskaper inom data- och nätverksmiljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en Microsoft-miljö.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Ett genuint intresse för teknik, mekanik och IT.
* Kvalitetsmedvetenhet och noggrannhet i ditt arbete.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i produktionsmiljö.
* Lösningsorienterad och proaktiv inställning.
* Strukturerad och ordningsam, med god förmåga att planera ditt arbete effektivt.
* En god kommunikatör som trivs med kundkontakt och har förmåga att upprätthålla goda relationer.
* En teamspelare som vill bidra till ett starkt och samarbetsinriktat team.
* B-körkort.


**Du kommer att behöva**
 För att lyckas i den här tjänsten tror vi att du är organiserad och trivs med att ge utmärkt kundservice. Du är dessutom en proaktiv och kreativ problemlösare som är van att ha en bra tidsplanering och som ständigt ser till att hitta förbättringar. Vi tror också att du har en stark drivkraft och beslutsamhet att lyckas.
   

  

**Ytterligare Information**
 Har du frågor gällande tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef via john.svard@canon.se . Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta HR via olivia.agne@canon.se .
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.Under semestertider kan vår återkoppling ta något längre tid. Vi ber om er förståelse och återkommer till er så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Kyosei** 
 är Canons företagsfilosofi och innebär ”att leva och arbeta tillsammans för allas bästa”. Med filosofin som ledord försöker Canon i alla rekryteringar skapa en arbetsplats som återspeglar mångfald och öppenhet. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss på vår karriärsida https//www.canon.se/careers/ .
   

  

 Canon berikar människors liv och företags verksamheter på häpnadsväckande nya sätt. Du kan bli en av oss och forma framtiden för ett starkt, ambitiöst och hänsynsfullt företag. Tillsammans gör vi skillnaden. Du kan förvänta dig de exceptionella och uppnå det exceptionella, med världens bästa bildföretag.
   

  

 Living and working together for the common good.

title: Global Business Health and Safety Specialist (flexible location)
description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
   

  

 That's our story. Make it your story.
   

  

 This position reports to
   

  

 HSE Business Head
   

  

 Your role and responsibilities
   

  

 As the Global Business Health and Safety Specialist, you will play a critical role in strengthening Health and Safety performance within the Motion Business by fostering a proactive and learning-driven safety culture. Rooted in Human and Organizational Performance (HOP) principles, you will champion “doing safety differently” by focusing on understanding how work happens, identifying and mitigating critical risks, and embedding pre- and post-incident learning.
   

  

 The work model for the role is: hybrid ;
   

  

 The role is contributing to the Motion Business Area in globally.
   

  

 You will be mainly accountable for:
   

  

* Champion for Manufacturing Safety: Supporting global and local divisions by promoting global processes and tools related to manufacturing safety.
* Policy and Standards Creation: Developing specific safety policies and standards in alignment with ABB Group policies, focusing on continuous improvement and proactive risk management.
* Lead Safety Investigation Program: Overseeing incident investigations, training staff in root-cause analysis, facilitating learning teams, coaching investigators, and managing documentation to ensure continuous safety improvements.
* Strategic Planning and Training: Contributing to strategy and continuous improvement of global safety processes, creating long-term plans, supporting implementation in manufacturing plants, and delivering training programs to foster a culture of proactive learning and risk awareness.


**Qualifications For The Role**
* Minimum 10-12 years of Health & Safety experience working at a senior expert level.
* Proven experience in leading safety investigations, incident investigations, risk assessments, facilitating learning teams, and mentoring investigators to ensure high-quality outcomes.
* Familiar with ISO 45001 and 14001 Management system and Competent in conducting ISO 45001 (OHSAS18001) audits.
* Familiar with machine safety standards like EN ISO 12100:2010, ISO 13857, ISO 13854, ISO 13850, ISO 13849, ISO 13855, ISO 14119.
* Experience in running safety programs, like risk management, safety leadership.
* Robot safety, machining safety, rotating machinery safety and related safety technologies.
* Overhead crane lifting safety, lifting tool safety, moving of cabinets, forklift safety, warehouse safety, contractor safety, working at height.
* Proven track record in a global manufacturing organization with expertise in critical risk management and knowledge of Human Organizational Performance.
* Confidence in navigation around legislations for area of responsibility.
* Fluent English language skills.


 More about us
   

  

 ABB Motion, a global leader in motors and drives, is at the core of accelerating a more productive and sustainable future. We innovate and push the boundaries of technology to contribute to energy efficient, decarbonizing and circular solutions for customers, industries and societies. With our digitally enabled drives, motors and services we support our customers and partners to achieve better performance, safety and reliability. To help the world’s industries outrun – leaner and cleaner, we deliver motor-driven solutions for a wide range of applications in all industrial segments. Building on over 140 years of domain expertise in electric powertrains, our more than 22,000 employees across 100 countries learn and improve every day. go.abb/motion
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.
   

  

  

**94242740**

title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Data Science and Epidemiology of Immune-Mediated Inflammatory Diseases
description:
**Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?** 




  





 Are you looking for a place to develop as a data-driven researcher, deepen your knowledge, and expand your skills? We can offer you a vibrant learning environment, ample opportunity to collaborate with experienced researchers, and freedom to develop your own ideas.
 



  





**Your mission** 




  





 The postdoctoral work will focus on long-term clinical outcomes in persons with immune-mediated inflammatory disease in rheumatology and neurology (primarily rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis) using high quality prospectively-collected data on treatment outcomes from electronic medical records and national registries. Our goal is to evaluate the risk of disease worsening and treatment-related adverse events in relation to patient characteristics, including pre-disease (prodromal) markers, comorbidity, imaging, biomarkers, and disease/modifying therapy exposure, integrating advanced machine learning techniques with traditional clinical epidemiology.
 



  





 The Postdoctoral Fellow will work with an international research team to design and conduct research relevant to the group’s agenda while receiving advanced training to enhance professional skills and research independence. The Postdoc’s time will be devoted to analysis, manuscript preparation and career development. The candidate will be asked to collaborate with others, including graduate students, and provide her/his expertise in team projects. There are no teaching requirements, but opportunities to teach can be facilitated.
 



  





**Your profile** 




  





 Experience with large health-related data sets is a requirement, as well as being an independent programmer with expertise in Python, R, STATA, or SAS and with advanced knowledge of relevant computational or statistical methods. An education in epidemiology/public health, biostatistics, or data science, documented excellent scientific writing ability, and strong oral communication skills in English are expected. As we have a close collaboration with patient representatives, clinical researchers and nurses, clinical experience and the ability to communicate popular science is a strong asset.
 



  





 To be eligible for employment as a postdoctor a phd or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a Swedish phd is required. This eligibility requirement must be fulfilled at the latest at the time of the employment decision. It is considered as an advantage if you have completed your doctoral degree within the last three years, if there are special reasons, your degree may have been completed earlier.
 



  





**What do we offer?** 




  





 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
 



  





**Location** 




  





 The position is located within the Department of Medicine, Solna. The department consists of ten divisions and each division consists of several research groups. The position will be in the team of Principal Researcher Thomas Frisell within the Clinical Epidemiology Division (KEP). At KEP, epidemiologists and biostatisticians work closely with clinician scientists to answer clinically important questions. In all, we are approximately 150 researchers at the Division. The Division also arranges a PhD program for clinicians, which provides teaching opportunities at the post-graduate level.
 



  





 In the Chronic Inflammatory Disease Research Group, there are approximately 50 people (Doctoral students, Postdoctoral Fellows, Professors, Senior Researchers) with different backgrounds but common research interests, namely the study of chronic inflammatory diseases using Swedish national registers and clinical data. We have a strong interest in cutting edge methodologies, and a wide network of research and clinical collaborators.
 



  





**Application** 




  





 An employment application must contain the following documents in English or Swedish:
 



  




* PhD certificate
* A complete resumé, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)



  





 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
 



  





**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**As our Marketing Coordinator,** 
 you will provide essential support on various aspects in the execution of Tobii Dynavox's marketing initiatives, ensuring that marketing efforts are well-organized, and contributing to success of our global MarCom strategies.
 



  





**Please note:** 
 This is entry-level role, ideal for recent graduates or individuals starting their career in marketing. If you want to get hands-on experience across multiple marketing functions, helping to enhance brand visibility and engagement, while supporting a dynamic and global team environment, this is an opportunity you can thrive at!
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Support MarCom Initiatives: Assist in the execution of MarCom strategies and campaigns, contributing to overall marketing goals.
* Project and Production Support: Coordinate marketing projects and productions by tracking timelines and deliverables, ensuring projects are completed efficiently and on time.
* Coordinate Merchandising and Giveaways: Assist in organizing and managing merchandising materials and giveaways to support brand visibility and customer engagement efforts.
* Event Coordination: Help in planning and executing MarCom-led events and activations, ensuring smooth logistics and alignment with marketing goals.
* Community Management: Support community engagement initiatives, helping to foster brand loyalty and maintain active relationships with target audiences.
* Assist with Localizations and Translations: Coordinate localization and translation efforts to ensure marketing content is relevant and effective in different regional markets.
* Administrative Support: Provide administrative assistance to the marketing team, including scheduling meetings, preparing materials, and tracking budgets.



  





**Please note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role our office, with approximately 1-2 days per week at our office in Stockholm city. This role also includes occasional (10%) domestic and/or international travel, which would be communicated weeks in advance.
 



  





**We are looking for someone that has:** 



* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent level of education in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Familiarity with marketing concepts, social media, digital marketing, or event management is a plus.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in dynamic environment.
* Attention to detail with a proactive approach to problem-solving.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Lead Quantitative Risk Analyst
description:
**Job ID: 27194** 


  
 





 Would you like to be a part of a team with experienced and talented colleagues, and to make a difference for Nordea’s credit risk models? We are currently looking for an experienced Lead Quantitative Risk Analysts to strengthen Nordea's independent model validation function.
 







  
 







**About our team** 








  
 







 Welcome to the Model Risk & Validation unit. We add value by advising and challenging the business areas and functions to use models within the bank’s model risk appetite.
 







 You will join a dynamic team of experienced model risk experts with diverse backgrounds and willingness to share their expertise. We work in a cross-border team with team members in Copenhagen, Helsinki, Stockholm and Warsaw.
 







  
 







 As a Lead Quantitative Risk Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that models satisfy internal and external standards for conceptual soundness, performance and use
 







  
 







**Main responsibility in this role** 





* Drive the validation of existing, new and changed credit risk models, with particular focus on collective provisioning and credit risk stress testing models
* Use quantitative and qualitative analyses to identify and assess model risk
* Develop and improve methods and processes for model validation
* Communicate the outcome of our reviews to a variety of stakeholders, including senior management
* Advise and guide model developers and other stakeholders in managing model risks





  
 







 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 





 The role is based in Helsinki; Stockholm; Warszawa.
 

  
 





  
 **This is the right role for you if you:** 





* Are confident in your analysis, but also willing to challenge your views with peers
* Engage in a productive collaboration with stakeholders including model owners/developers
* Enjoy working in a team, but also master working independently
* Have an eye for detail, yet able to see the big picture
* Have excellent skills in spoken and written communication (English)
* Effectively communicate complex topics to a variety of stakeholders





  
 







**Your background and skills include:** 





* Professional track record of working with models in the financial sector, preferably models within collective provisioning (IFRS9) or alternatively IRB and credit risk stress testing models
* Academic degree– in a quantitative field, such as mathematics, statistics, finance, engineering, physics, economics or similar
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements relating to credit risk
* Programming experience preferably in Python but other programming knowledge is also valuable
* Experience in model development, validation and/or risk management from the financial industry; working in a second or third line of defence unit, or in a similar position at the regulatory authorities is an advantage



  
 



  
 



**What we offer** 




  
 



 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward. 
 



  
 



 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment. 
 



  
 



 Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility. 
 



  
 



 Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving. 
 



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 20/01/2025
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Daphne Konrad.
 







  
 







 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward. 
 







  
 







 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment. 
 







  
 







**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility. 
 







  
 







**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Chartersi n the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving. 
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 







  
 







**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 







  
 







 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







  
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
